meanings.definition: A fixed sum of money paid to someone each year, typically for the rest of their life.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather receives annuities every year to support his retirement.
meanings.sent2: Retirees often rely on annuities as a steady source of income.
meanings.sent3: The jokester said he wanted to be paid in annuities so he could laugh all the way to the bank each year.
meanings.sent4: Annuities are like a financial hug that keeps you warm with money every year.
meanings.sent5: The concept of annuities is like planting a money tree that bears fruit annually.

meanings.definition: A form of insurance or investment entitling the investor to a series of annual sums.
meanings.sent1: She decided to invest in annuities to secure a stable financial future.
meanings.sent2: Annuities can provide a sense of financial security for the future.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that his disappearing act was funded by magical annuities.
meanings.sent4: Investing in annuities is like having a money tree that grows a new branch every year.
meanings.sent5: The idea of annuities is like having a reliable financial friend who visits you annually.
